intro: Hieracium mitolenum, commonly known as the Italian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy and alternate, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Hieracium mitolenum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its resilience to environmental stress.
